DescribeFHIRDatastore.name: DescribeFHIRDatastore
DescribeFHIRDatastore.documentation: Get properties for a FHIR-enabled data store.

DescribeFHIRImportJob.name: DescribeFHIRImportJob
DescribeFHIRImportJob.documentation: Get the import job properties to learn more about the job or job progress.

ListFHIRDatastores.name: ListFHIRDatastores
ListFHIRDatastores.documentation: List all FHIR-enabled data stores in a userâ€™s account, regardless of data store status.

ListFHIRExportJobs.name: ListFHIRExportJobs
ListFHIRExportJobs.documentation: Lists all FHIR export jobs associated with an account and their statuses.

ListFHIRImportJobs.name: ListFHIRImportJobs
ListFHIRImportJobs.documentation: List all FHIR import jobs associated with an account and their statuses.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Returns a list of all existing tags associated with a data store.

StartFHIRImportJob.name: StartFHIRImportJob
StartFHIRImportJob.documentation: Start importing bulk FHIR data into an ACTIVE data store. The import job imports FHIR data found in the InputDataConfig object and stores processing results in the JobOutputDataConfig object.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Add a user-specifed key and value tag to a data store.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Remove a user-specifed key and value tag from a data store.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: Access is denied. Your account is not authorized to perform this operation.

ConflictException.documentation: The data store is in a transition state and the user requested action cannot be performed.

DatastoreTypeVersion.documentation: The FHIR release version supported by the data store. Current support is for version R4.

SseConfiguration.documentation: The server-side encryption key configuration for a customer-provided encryption key specified for creating a data store.

PreloadDataConfig.documentation: An optional parameter to preload (import) open source Synthea FHIR data upon creation of the data store.

ClientToken.documentation: An optional user-provided token to ensure API idempotency.

Tags.documentation: The resource tags applied to a data store when it is created.

IdentityProviderConfiguration.documentation: The identity provider configuration to use for the data store.

DatastoreArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the data store.

DatastoreEndpoint.documentation: The AWS endpoint created for the data store.

CreatedBefore.documentation: Filter to set cutoff dates for records. All data stores created before the specified date are included in the results.

CreatedAfter.documentation: Filter to set cutoff dates for records. All data stores created after the specified date are included in the results.

DatastoreFilter.documentation: The filters applied to a data store query.

DatastoreArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used in the creation of the data store.

CreatedAt.documentation: The time the data store was created.

DatastoreTypeVersion.documentation: The FHIR release version supported by the data store. Current support is for version R4.

DatastoreEndpoint.documentation: The AWS endpoint for the data store.

SseConfiguration.documentation: The server-side encryption key configuration for a customer provided encryption key.

PreloadDataConfig.documentation: The preloaded Synthea data configuration for the data store.

IdentityProviderConfiguration.documentation: The identity provider selected during data store creation.

ErrorCause.documentation: The error cause for the current data store operation.

DatastoreId.documentation: The AWS-generated identifier for the data store to be deleted.
The AWS-generated ID for the deleted data store.

DatastoreArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that grants access permission to AWS HealthLake.

DatastoreEndpoint.documentation: The AWS endpoint of the data store to be deleted.

DatastoreId.documentation: The data store identifier from which FHIR data is being exported from.

SubmitTime.documentation: The time the export job was initiated.

DatastoreId.documentation: The data store identifier from which files are being exported.

OutputDataConfig.documentation: The output data configuration supplied when the export job was created.

DataAccessRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used during the initiation of the export job.

Message.documentation: An explanation of any errors that might have occurred during the export job.

ExportJobProperties.documentation: The properties of a FHIR export job.

AuthorizationStrategy.documentation:
The authorization strategy selected when the HealthLake data store is created.

HealthLake provides support for both SMART on FHIR V1 and V2 as described below.

  • SMART_ON_FHIR_V1 â€“ Support for only SMART on FHIR V1, which includes read (read/search) and write (create/update/delete) permissions.

  • SMART_ON_FHIR â€“ Support for both SMART on FHIR V1 and V2, which includes create, read, update, delete, and search permissions.

  • AWS_AUTH â€“ The default HealthLake authorization strategy; not affiliated with SMART on FHIR.

FineGrainedAuthorizationEnabled.documentation: The parameter to enable SMART on FHIR fine-grained authorization for the data store.

Metadata.documentation:
The JSON metadata elements to use in your identity provider configuration. Required elements are listed based on the launch specification of the SMART application. For more information on all possible elements, see Metadata in SMART's App Launch specification.

authorization_endpoint: The URL to the OAuth2 authorization endpoint.

grant_types_supported: An array of grant types that are supported at the token endpoint. You must provide at least one grant type option. Valid options are authorization_code and client_credentials.

token_endpoint: The URL to the OAuth2 token endpoint.

capabilities: An array of strings of the SMART capabilities that the authorization server supports.

code_challenge_methods_supported: An array of strings of supported PKCE code challenge methods. You must include the S256 method in the array of PKCE code challenge methods.

IdpLambdaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function to use to decode the access token created by the authorization server.

IdentityProviderConfiguration.documentation: The identity provider configuration selected when the data store was created.

SubmitTime.documentation: The time the import job was submitted for processing.

EndTime.documentation: The time the import job was completed.

InputDataConfig.documentation: The input data configuration supplied when the import job was created.

JobProgressReport.documentation: Displays the progress of the import job, including total resources scanned, total resources imported, and total size of data imported.

DataAccessRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that grants AWS HealthLake access to the input data.

Message.documentation: An explanation of any errors that might have occurred during the FHIR import job.

ValidationLevel.documentation: The validation level of the import job.

S3Uri.documentation: The S3Uri is the user-specified S3 location of the FHIR data to be imported into AWS HealthLake.

InternalServerException.documentation: An unknown internal error occurred in the service.

TotalNumberOfScannedFiles.documentation: The number of files scanned from the S3 input bucket.

TotalSizeOfScannedFilesInMB.documentation: The size (in MB) of files scanned from the S3 input bucket.

TotalNumberOfResourcesScanned.documentation: The number of resources scanned from the S3 input bucket.

TotalNumberOfResourcesWithCustomerError.documentation: The number of resources that failed due to customer error.

TotalNumberOfFilesReadWithCustomerError.documentation: The number of files that failed to be read from the S3 input bucket due to customer error.

Throughput.documentation: The transaction rate the import job is processed at.

JobProgressReport.documentation: The progress report for the import job.

CmkType.documentation: The type of customer-managed-key (CMK) used for encryption.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The Key Management Service (KMS) encryption key id/alias used to encrypt the data store contents at rest.

KmsEncryptionConfig.documentation: The customer-managed-key (CMK) used when creating a data store. If a customer-owned key is not specified, an AWS-owned key is used for encryption.

Filter.documentation: List all filters associated with a FHIR data store request.

NextToken.documentation: The token used to retrieve the next page of data stores when results are paginated.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of data stores returned on a page.

DatastorePropertiesList.documentation: The properties associated with all listed data stores.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results.

DatastoreId.documentation: Limits the response to the export job with the specified data store ID.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token used to identify the next page of results to return.

MaxResults.documentation: Limits the number of results returned for a ListFHIRExportJobs to a maximum quantity specified by the user.

JobName.documentation: Limits the response to the export job with the specified job name.

JobStatus.documentation: Limits the response to export jobs with the specified job status.

SubmittedBefore.documentation: Limits the response to FHIR export jobs submitted before a user- specified date.

SubmittedAfter.documentation: Limits the response to FHIR export jobs submitted after a user-specified date.

ExportJobPropertiesList.documentation: The properties of listed FHIR export jobs.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token used to identify the next page of results to return.

DatastoreId.documentation: Limits the response to the import job with the specified data store ID.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token used to identify the next page of results to return.

MaxResults.documentation: Limits the number of results returned for ListFHIRImportJobs to a maximum quantity specified by the user.

JobName.documentation: Limits the response to the import job with the specified job name.

JobStatus.documentation: Limits the response to the import job with the specified job status.

SubmittedBefore.documentation: Limits the response to FHIR import jobs submitted before a user- specified date.

SubmittedAfter.documentation: Limits the response to FHIR import jobs submitted after a user-specified date.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token used to identify the next page of results to return.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data store to which tags are being added.

Tags.documentation: Returns a list of tags associated with a data store.

S3Configuration.documentation: The output data configuration supplied when the export job was created.

OutputDataConfig.documentation: The output data configuration supplied when the export job was created.

PreloadDataType.documentation: The type of preloaded data. Only Synthea preloaded data is supported.

PreloadDataConfig.documentation: The input properties for the preloaded (Synthea) data store.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The requested data store was not found.

S3Uri.documentation: The S3Uri is the user-specified S3 location of the FHIR data to be imported into AWS HealthLake.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID used to access the S3 bucket.

S3Configuration.documentation: The configuration of the S3 bucket for either an import or export job. This includes assigning access permissions.

KmsEncryptionConfig.documentation: The Key Management Service (KMS) encryption configuration used to provide details for data encryption.

SseConfiguration.documentation: The server-side encryption key configuration for a customer-provided encryption key.

OutputDataConfig.documentation: The output data configuration supplied when the export job was started.

DatastoreId.documentation: The data store identifier from which files are being exported.

DataAccessRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used during initiation of the export job.

ClientToken.documentation: An optional user provided token used for ensuring API idempotency.

DatastoreId.documentation: The data store identifier from which files are being exported.

InputDataConfig.documentation: The input properties for the import job request.

DataAccessRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that grants access permission to AWS HealthLake.

ClientToken.documentation: The optional user-provided token used for ensuring API idempotency.

ValidationLevel.documentation: The validation level of the import job.

Key.documentation: The key portion of a tag. Tag keys are case sensitive.

Value.documentation: The value portion of a tag. Tag values are case-sensitive.

Tag.documentation: A label consisting of a user-defined key and value. The form for tags is {"Key", "Value"}

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that grants access to the data store tags are being added to.

Tags.documentation: The user-specified key and value pair tags being added to a data store.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The user has exceeded their maximum number of allowed calls to the given API.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data store from which tags are being removed.

TagKeys.documentation: The keys for the tags to be removed from the data store.

documentation: This is the AWS HealthLake API Reference. For an introduction to the service, see What is AWS HealthLake? in the AWS HealthLake Developer Guide.
